Antidepressant Medication Management.description: The percentage of members 22 years of age and older who were treated with antidepressant medication, had a diagnosis of major depression and who remained on an antidepressant medication treatment for at least 180 days (6 months).
denominator_exclusions: No major depression diagnosis within 121 days of IPSD
Antidepressant medication dispensed 105 days prior to IPSD
methods_to_close_gap: At least 180 days of continuous antidepressant medication treatment
Allowable gaps of up to 52 days for medication change or refill delays
best_practices: Encourage patients to report side effects before stopping medication
Schedule follow-ups within the first six months
Educate patients on medication effects and adherence

Pharyngitis Treatment.description: The percentage of episodes for members 22 years and older where the member was diagnosed with pharyngitis, dispensed an antibiotic, and received a group A streptococcus (strep) test.
denominator_exclusions: No antibiotics dispensed within 3 days of diagnosis
Competing diagnosis within 3 days of episode
methods_to_close_gap: Group A streptococcus test within 7-day period around diagnosis
best_practices: Perform strep test before prescribing antibiotics
Educate patients on viral vs. bacterial infections
Discuss risks of antibiotic overuse and resistance

Upper Respiratory Infection (URI) Treatm.description: The percentage of episodes for members 22 years and older with a diagnosis of upper respiratory infection (URI) that did not result in an antibiotic dispensing event.
denominator_exclusions: Competing diagnosis within 3 days of episode
methods_to_close_gap: No antibiotic prescribed unless a comorbid/competing diagnosis is present
best_practices: Educate patients on unnecessary antibiotic risks
Promote hygiene and handwashing
Explain symptom management for viral infections
Submit comorbid/competing diagnosis codes when applicable

Asthma Medication Ratio.description: The percentage of members 22-64 years of age who were identified as having persistent asthma and had a ratio of controller medications to total asthma medications of 0.50 or greater during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: Other respiratory diseases requiring different treatment
No asthma controller or reliever medications dispensed
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a medication ratio of ≥0.50 by increasing controller medication usage
best_practices: Update prescriptions with dosage changes for future refills
Develop an asthma care plan with the patient
Identify and avoid asthma triggers
Monitor symptom control and inhaler use at each visit
Encourage 90-day fills and automatic refills for controller medications

Breast Cancer Screening.description: The percentage of members 50-74 years of age who were recommended for routine breast cancer screening and had a mammogram.
denominator_exclusions: Advanced illness and frailty in members 66+ years
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one mammogram within the last two years
best_practices: Use reminders to discuss screening every two years
Offer flexible scheduling for mammograms
Schedule appointments while patients are in-office
Send invitation letters and reminder calls
Address logistical barriers such as transportation and childcare

Cervical Cancer Screening.description: The percentage of members 22-64 years of age who were recommended for routine cervical cancer screening and were screened using cervical cytology or HPV testing.
denominator_exclusions: Cervical agenesis or absence of cervix
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure cervical cytology every three years or HPV testing every five years
best_practices: Use EMRs to track due/overdue screenings
Perform Pap testing in PCP office when possible
Encourage routine gynecologic visits
Frame screening as routine preventive care

Chlamydia Screening in Women.description: The percentage of women 22-24 years of age who were identified as sexually active and had at least one test for chlamydia during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: Pregnancy test with isotretinoin or X-ray within 6 days
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one chlamydia test during the measurement year
best_practices: Promote routine screening beginning at age 16
Normalize chlamydia screening as standard care
Offer in-office urine testing to improve completion rates
Educate patients on untreated chlamydia complications
Ensure correct coding to minimize patient out-of-pocket costs

Colorectal Cancer Screening.description: The percentage of members 45–75 years of age who had appropriate screening for colorectal cancer.
denominator_exclusions: Advanced illness and frailty in members 66+ years
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one colorectal cancer screening within the appropriate timeframe
best_practices: Offer multiple screening options (colonoscopy, FIT, sDNA test)
Use EHR reminders to identify overdue patients
Schedule colonoscopy while patients are in-office
Provide FIT kits with clear instructions and return deadlines
Follow up with patients who have not completed their screening

Controlling High Blood Pressure.description: The percentage of members 22–85 years of age who had a diagnosis of hypertension (HTN) and whose blood pressure (BP) was adequately controlled (<140/90 mm Hg) during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: Advanced illness and frailty in members 66+ years
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure the most recent BP reading is <140/90 mm Hg
best_practices: Educate patients on diet, exercise, and lifestyle factors affecting BP
Encourage medication adherence
Recheck BP after patient has rested in the clinic
Refer to care management for chronic disease support
Use EHR alerts for patients with uncontrolled BP

Eye Exam for Patients with Diabetes.description: The percentage of members 22-75 years of age with diabetes (types 1 and 2) who had a retinal eye exam.
denominator_exclusions: Advanced illness and frailty in members 66+ years
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a retinal or dilated eye exam within the measurement period
best_practices: Educate patients on the importance of annual eye exams
Provide on-site retinal screenings where possible
Develop referral partnerships with eye care providers
Use patient reminders via text, email, or phone
Submit negative exam results from the prior year to close gaps

Follow-Up After Emergency Department Vis.description: The percentage of emergency department (ED) visits for members 22 years of age and older who have multiple high-risk chronic conditions and had a follow-up service within 7 days of the ED visit.
denominator_exclusions: ED visits resulting in inpatient admission
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure follow-up service within 7 days after an ED visit
best_practices: Develop processes to identify patients in the ED
Encourage patients to notify PCP after ED discharge
Use case management for transition-of-care coordination
Follow up with patients through phone, telehealth, or office visits
Use EHR tracking to ensure timely follow-up care

Glycemic Status Assessment for Patients.description: The percentage of members 22-75 years of age with diabetes (types 1 and 2) whose most recent glycemic status (hemoglobin A1c [HbA1c] or glucose management indicator [GMI]) was at the appropriate level during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: Advanced illness and frailty in members 66+ years
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure HbA1c < 8.0% for Commercial, Medicaid, and Marketplace members
Ensure HbA1c < 9.0% for Medicare members
best_practices: Submit CPT II codes or upload results where no lab feed exists
Identify members needing self-management education
Encourage engagement with a certified diabetes educator
Monitor and adjust medications to maintain glycemic control

Kidney Health Evaluation for Patients wi.description: The percentage of members 22–85 years of age with diabetes (type 1 and type 2) who received a kidney health evaluation, defined by an estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) and a urine albumin-creatinine ratio (uACR), during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: Advanced illness and frailty in members 66+ years
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure both an eGFR and a uACR test during the measurement year
best_practices: Provide on-site urine specimen collection
Use clinical decision support tools for adherence tracking
Educate patients on diabetes and kidney health management
Encourage early intervention to prevent kidney disease progression

Medication Adherence for Cholesterol (St.description: The percentage of plan members with a prescription for a cholesterol medication (a statin drug) who fill their prescription often enough to cover 80 percent or more of the time they are supposed to be taking the medication.
denominator_exclusions: End-stage renal disease (ESRD) diagnosis or dialysis coverage
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a proportion of days covered (PDC) threshold of 80% during the measurement year
best_practices: Encourage patients to use UPMC ID cards for statin prescriptions
Promote 100-day prescription fills for Medicare members
Ensure pharmacies receive updated prescriptions with dosage changes
Encourage automatic refills and medication adherence tools (e.g., pillboxes)

Medication Adherence for Diabetes.description: The percentage of plan members with a prescription for diabetes medication who fill their prescription often enough to cover 80 percent or more of the time they are supposed to be taking the medication.
denominator_exclusions: End-stage renal disease (ESRD) diagnosis or dialysis coverage
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a proportion of days covered (PDC) threshold of 80% during the measurement year
best_practices: Encourage patients to use UPMC ID cards for diabetes medications
Promote 100-day prescription fills for Medicare members
Ensure pharmacy updates prescriptions for dose or instruction changes
Educate patients on the importance of adherence to diabetes medications
Use automatic refills and patient engagement strategies

Medication Adherence for Hypertension (R.description: The percentage of plan members with a prescription for a blood pressure medication who fill their prescription often enough to cover 80 percent or more of the time they are supposed to be taking the medication.
denominator_exclusions: End-stage renal disease (ESRD) diagnosis or dialysis coverage
One or more prescriptions for sacubitril/valsartan
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a proportion of days covered (PDC) threshold of 80% during the measurement year
best_practices: Encourage 100-day prescription fills for Medicare members
Ensure pharmacy updates prescriptions for dose or instruction changes
Promote automatic refills and adherence tools
Use preferred pharmacies for better medication adherence tracking

Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge.description: The percentage of discharges for members 22 years of age and older who had documentation of medication reconciliation on the date of discharge through 30 days after discharge (31 total days).
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure medication reconciliation by a prescribing practitioner, pharmacist, PA, or nurse within 30 days post-discharge
best_practices: Develop a process for completing medication reconciliation for all hospital discharge patients
Use telephonic or face-to-face medication reviews
Encourage patients to bring all medications to post-discharge visits
Address financial or adherence barriers to medication access

Patient Engagement After Inpatient Disch.description: The percentage of discharges for members 22 years of age and older who had documentation of patient engagement (e.g., office visits, home visits, telehealth) provided within 30 days after discharge.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure patient engagement through outpatient visits, telephone visits, e-visits, or virtual check-ins within 30 days post-discharge
best_practices: Utilize ADT reports to identify patients needing follow-up
Conduct outreach for patients without a scheduled follow-up within two weeks
Offer telehealth or virtual check-ins if transportation is a barrier
Address patient concerns regarding treatment, medications, and symptoms

Pharmacotherapy Management of COPD – Bro.description: The percentage of COPD exacerbations for members 40 years of age and older who had an acute inpatient discharge or ED visit and were dispensed a bronchodilator within 30 days.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a bronchodilator prescription is dispensed within 30 days of a COPD-related hospital or ED visit
best_practices: Follow up with COPD patients within 5 days of discharge
Ensure medication adherence for post-discharge COPD treatment
Educate patients on inhaler techniques and adherence
Encourage smoking cessation and lifestyle modifications

Plan All-Cause Readmissions.description: The number of acute inpatient and observation stays during the measurement year that were followed by an unplanned acute readmission for any diagnosis within 30 days.
methods_to_close_gap: Prevent readmissions through proper discharge planning and post-hospital follow-up
best_practices: Utilize ADT reports to identify recently discharged patients needing follow-up
Ensure timely follow-up visits post-discharge
Address common causes of readmission such as medication issues and symptom management
Educate patients on when to seek primary care versus emergency care

Statin Therapy for Patients with Cardiov.description: The percentage of males 22-75 years old and females 40-75 years old during the measurement year who were identified as having clinical atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) and who were dispensed at least one high-intensity or moderate-intensity statin medication during the measurement year.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one dispensing event for a high-intensity or moderate-intensity statin medication
best_practices: Prescribe a statin for secondary prevention in ASCVD patients
Educate providers on appropriate exclusions
Assess patient adherence and barriers to compliance
Consider rechallenging patients with statin intolerance using alternative dosing

Statin Therapy for Patients with Diabete.description: The percentage of members 40-75 years of age during the measurement year with diabetes who do not have clinical atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) and who were dispensed at least one statin medication of any intensity during the measurement year.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one dispensing event for a high-, moderate-, or low-intensity statin medication
best_practices: Prescribe statins to all patients with diabetes ages 40-75 per ADA/AHA guidelines
Address adherence barriers and encourage medication refills
Utilize formularies that offer statins at no cost-share where applicable

Statin Use in Persons with Diabetes.description: The percentage of members 40-75 years old who were dispensed at least two diabetes medication fills and received a statin medication fill during the measurement period.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure patients receiving diabetes medications are also prescribed a statin
best_practices: Identify diabetes patients who are not currently on a statin
Discuss benefits of statins in preventing cardiovascular disease
Encourage adherence and refill compliance

Adult Immunization Status: Influenza.description: The percentage of members 22 years of age and older who are up to date on recommended routine influenza vaccines.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure influenza vaccination is given between July 1 of the prior year and June 30 of the measurement year
best_practices: Encourage annual flu vaccination in all eligible adults
Use standing orders for flu shots in clinical settings
Offer vaccinations at convenient locations such as pharmacies and workplaces

Adult Immunization Status: Tdap.description: The percentage of members 22 years of age and older who are up to date on recommended routine tetanus and diphtheria (Td) or tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis (Tdap) vaccines.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one Td or Tdap vaccine within the past 9 years
best_practices: Promote routine Td or Tdap vaccination during annual checkups
Educate patients on the importance of maintaining immunity against pertussis
Offer vaccinations in convenient settings such as pharmacies

Avoidance of Treatment for Acute Bronchi.description: The percentage of episodes for members 22 years and older with a diagnosis of acute bronchitis/bronchiolitis that did not result in an antibiotic dispensing event.
denominator_exclusions: Competing diagnosis on or 3 days after episode date
Antibiotic prescription 30 days prior or active on episode date
methods_to_close_gap: No antibiotic prescription unless there is a comorbid or competing diagnosis
best_practices: Educate patients about the risks of unnecessary antibiotics
Explain viral vs. bacterial infections
Recommend symptom relief such as fluids, rest, and monitoring symptoms
Submit appropriate comorbid or competing diagnosis codes when applicable

Blood Pressure Control for Patients with.description: The percentage of members 22–75 years of age with diabetes (types 1 and 2) whose blood pressure (BP) was adequately controlled (<140/90 mm Hg) during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: Frailty and advanced illness in members 66+ years
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure last recorded BP is <140/90 mm Hg
Use lowest systolic and diastolic values from multiple readings on same date
best_practices: Educate patients on diet, exercise, and lifestyle factors affecting BP
Encourage medication adherence
Ensure accurate BP measurements by rechecking if elevated initially
Refer patients to chronic disease management programs

Concurrent Use of Opioids and Benzodiaze.description: The percentage of individuals 22 years of age and older who did not have concurrent use of prescription opioids and benzodiazepines.
methods_to_close_gap: No concurrent opioid and benzodiazepine use for ≥30 cumulative days
best_practices: Consider alternatives to benzodiazepines if the patient is already on opioids
Assess whether tapering is clinically appropriate and individualize tapering plans
Limit dose and duration if new therapy is necessary
Prioritize gradual discontinuation for long-term users of both medication classes

Osteoporosis Management in Women Who Had.description: The percentage of women 67–85 years of age who suffered a fracture and who had either a bone mineral density (BMD) test or prescription for a drug to treat osteoporosis in the 180 days (six months) after the fracture.
denominator_exclusions: Frailty and advanced illness in members 67+ years
Recent bone mineral density test (within 730 days)
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure BMD test or osteoporosis treatment within 180 days post-fracture
best_practices: Encourage lifestyle changes to reduce fracture risk (e.g., smoking cessation, fall prevention)
Ensure women with fractures receive a BMD test or osteoporosis treatment promptly
Educate patients on the importance of osteoporosis management and fracture prevention

Polypharmacy: Use of Multiple Anticholin.description: The percentage of individuals ≥65 years of age who do not have concurrent use of ≥2 unique anticholinergic medications.
methods_to_close_gap: No concurrent use for ≥30 cumulative days of ≥2 unique anticholinergic medications
best_practices: Limit use of multiple anticholinergic medications in older adults
Evaluate patient medication lists for potential deprescribing opportunities
Monitor for cognitive decline and anticholinergic burden in elderly patients

Polypharmacy: Use of Multiple CNS-Active.description: The percentage of individuals ≥65 years of age who do not have concurrent use of ≥3 unique central-nervous system (CNS)-active medications.
methods_to_close_gap: No concurrent use for ≥30 cumulative days of ≥3 unique CNS-active medications
best_practices: Limit use of multiple CNS-active medications in older adults
Prioritize gradual discontinuation when possible
Consider non-pharmacologic alternatives for sleep and anxiety management
